RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 1 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered Fo r $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEVERPOPTHECORK saved early ground then bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased outward toward mid-stretch and dug in to get up the final yards. I'LLTAKECAREOFIT took a quick slim lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn, but was caught flattening stride in the final yards. HARDLY EVER BETTER stalked two deep, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then flattened leaving the eighth pole. MAKIN' GOLD stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and weakened. HAZEDNCONFUSED raced in the three path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. JAZZ WITH DENIS raced off the rail the first turn, proved to be no factor and was eased.

ENTRY.NAME: I'lltakecareofit
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,caught flattening

ENTRY.NAME: Neverpopthecork
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,rail far turn,eased out 1/16,up final yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 13200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 1, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Ent ered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CURLIN'S THRILL settled toward the inside then bid nearing the three eighths pole, improved two deep on the far turn, took the nod leaving the turn and dug in determinedly to eke out the advantage through the stretch. MR HOOVER rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, gave up the nod leaving the turn but dug in gamely to the finish. MOON OVER MONTANA saved early ground, bid leaving the half mile pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and dug in to clear third later yards. MAKE WAY stalked the early pace, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn then flattened late stretch. MONGOLIAN HERO settled inside, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and flattened in the lane. ROYAL CRUSADER raced off the pace about the four path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole and weakened in the five path of the far turn. PRACTICALLY THERE raced in the four and five path the first two turns and showed little response through the backstretch. The Stewards reviewed then rejected a claim of foul against the rider of Curlin's Thrill for alleged interference leaving the far turn, lodged by the rider of Mr Hoover.

ENTRY.NAME: Moon Over Montana
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 1/2,5p far turn,cleared 3rd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Hoover
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Truett Wilbur
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,met 1/8,gamely lane

ENTRY.NAME: Curlin's Thrill
ENTRY.OWNER: Deckert Jr Robert and Brown Keith A

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 76. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KASIMBA rated close toward the inside, challenged nearing the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead passing the five sixteenths, cleared Fast Forward two deep midway on the far turn and was steadily handled to hold off LUNAR MISSION, while the latter settled back inside on the first turn, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole, improved at the rail on the far turn and finished well at the outside girth of the winner. RUM CUP became fractious in the gate then saved ground on the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, raced two deep on the far turn and came along to take third past the eighth pole. TEMPESTIVO raced two deep on the first turn and left the turn outside, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the five path and showed little more. FAST FORWARD closed to a slim lead approaching the three quarter pole and rated the early pace, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was met past the five sixteenths, dropped back midway on the far turn and weakened. GETTIN SPICY stalked the early pace in the three path then moved to the inside midway on the opening turn and showed little response. KNOWWHATIMEAN came away awkwardly and steadied leaving the gate, raced in the five path the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Rum Cup
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious in gate,saved ground,chased 1/2,3p far turn,along 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Kasimba
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John and Longball Stables LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Lunar Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside,bid 3/8,improved rail far turn,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Fast Forward
ENTRY.OWNER: Shive Charles Clark Patrick and Bright Derrick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 92. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 24000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-w inners Of A Race Since October 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 1 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUE LOVES BARBADOS stalked the early pace inside, bid nearing the three eighths pole and closed to the lead in the three path midway on the far turn, raced clear into the stretch and steadily increased his lead the final sixteenth. RAD PAISLEY stalked the early pace two deep, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and dueled through later yards for second. SCOTTSDALE rated a short lead inside, came under pressure nearing the five sixteenths pole, was met at the rail midway on the far turn, dropped back entering the stretch and relented in the later duel for second. MARTINKELLY raced off the rail on the first turn then eased out entering the backstretch, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and flattened in the lane. FEARNOUGHT saved ground and showed little response. CLASSY AMERICAN stalked the early pace from the three path, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole then weakened in the four path on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Scottsdale
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 5/16,met rail mid turn,relented lane

ENTRY.NAME: Martinkelly
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 1 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SCARLET REBEL had a brief early lead then gave chase toward the three eighths pole, raced close off the rail on the turn, dug in for the lead passing the sixteenth pole, edged briefly clear then held on. SHEWEARSSTILETTOS chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn, eased out past the sixteenth pole and took second the final yards while gaining on the winner. XTENDED STREAK closed to the lead nearing the three eighths pole and rated the early pace, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn near the rail, was met leaving the sixteenth pole and flattened the final yards. NEW AGE BAD GIRL gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. O K SMARTY PANTS chased outside, raced in the four path on the turn and passed rivals in the lane. ESSENTIAL MAGIC chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and weakened. OFFICER CALLY chased outside, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane. LIL BOUGIE gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: New Age Bad Girl
ENTRY.OWNER: Krishack Joanne P and Krishack Stephan E

ENTRY.NAME: Shewearsstilettos
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Essential Magic
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Scarlet Rebel
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead,chased,off rail turn,up inside 1/16,held on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 13200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 1, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Ent ered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INDIANA RED rated close inside leaving the mile marker, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole and took the lead two deep toward the head of the lane, drew clear past the eighth pole and was steadily handled to widen. HONOR THE FLEET took the lead three wide at the thirteen sixteenths pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure nearing the five sixteenths, was met at the rail toward the head of the lane, dropped back leaving the eighth pole and settled for second best. LOKOYA ROAD raced off the rail, gave chase passing the half mile pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and dueled through the stretch for third. MAGNETRON steadied leaving the gate and settled off the rail, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. CANTAKEITANYMORE rated close to the early pace about the three path but faded into the second turn. CHESAPEAKE CHARLIE settled off the rail and showed little response through the backstretch. WHAT'S TO BLAME raced off the pace in the three and four paths, left the second turn outside and showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Lokoya Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased past 1/2,off rail far turn,dueled 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 75. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mil e Or Over Since October 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since September 1 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VAGABOND VIRGIN settled off the pace about the three path, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced close off the rail on the far turn, was bumped off stride passing the eighth pole but dug in determinedly to edge ahead of the runner-up late yards. REY O REYES angled in approaching the mile pole and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn but ducked out and made sharp contact with Vagabond Virgin passing the eighth pole, dug in to that one from that point but succumbed inside the sixteenth pole. O'RIGSBY settled off the rail early, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and came along for third late yards. SUMMONING DENIS steadied off the inside flank of Leg Up into the first turn then settled back in the four and five paths, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and passed rivals in the lane. TYRY TYRANNOSAURUS raced off the rail early, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and showed little in the lane. LEG UP was forced in approaching the mile pole then stalked inside, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened. KAYLEE'S SPITFIRE rated close to the early pace inside and rounded the second turn about the three path, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole but weakened into the far turn. S S SPARTAN ENERGY was not a factor. CHASE LIL ME raced in the six path early and never factored. MY BUDDY DUANE saved ground well off the pace and faded leaving the half mile pole. The Steward reviewed then rejected a claim of foul against the rider of Rey O Reyes for alleged interference in the vicinity of the mile pole, lodged by the rider of Summoning Denis.

ENTRY.NAME: Kaylee's Spitfire
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close early,chased 3/8,weakened into far turn

ENTRY.NAME: O'Rigsby
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,along 3rd late yards

ENTRY.NAME: Rey O Reyes
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 37. Maiden Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STORMI VANNA rated close inside through the backstretch, eased to the three path with a bid leaving the quarter pole, dug in from the head of the lane, got up later yards and widened approaching the wire. LIME STAR gave chase through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn, dug in from the eighth pole, eased out late and took second under the wire. MIRACLE SONDE had a brief early lead then pressured the pace and took the lead passing the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn near the rail but was met while flattening stride later yards. VIESTE gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and could only improve her position. VERITAS LUX MEA chased outside, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane. JUST ASK ME took the lead toward the seven sixteenths pole and set a pressured early pace, but was met at the rail leaving the five sixteenths pole and weakened. BIT OF BLESSINGS became fractious in the gate, fell leaving the gate but got up and walked off post race. The Stewards reviewed the start of this race before declaring it official.

ENTRY.NAME: Bit of Blessings
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious in gate,fell break,lost rider,walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Stormi Vanna
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,eased out,bid 1/4,dug in lane,up late,cleared
